business.headline: Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue their rally?After heavy selling in earlier sessions, FPIs turned net buyers and purchased shares worth Rs 2,201.79 corer in the last session.
IndusInd Bank posts first loss in nearly 2 decades, flags employee fraudIndusInd Bank said its Q4 numbers reflect the impact of all the discrepancies identified so far through ongoing investigations.

After Uber, government likely to probe Rapido over advance tips for rideThe government crackdown on ride-hailing apps urging advance tipping may soon widen. After Uber, Rapido could be next in line for a probe over the controversial feature.

Government notice to Uber over 'advance tip' feature for faster serviceWhile booking a ride, Uber prompts users to tip Rs 50, 75, or 100 — not for service rendered, but for faster confirmation and pickup.

India seeks full 26% tariff exemption in trade deal with US: ReportThe reciprocal duty, announced by the Trump administration on April 2, is currently suspended until July 9 under a 90-day pause meant to allow room for negotiations. The US's baseline 10% tariff, however, remains in place.

Onion glut crashes prices across Maharashtra, farmers count lossesIn Navi Mumbai's Vashi APMC—the main supplier of onions to the Mumbai Metropolitan Region—wholesale prices have dropped from Rs 35–40 per kilogram in February to just Rs 7–17 in May.
Sensex ends 410 points higher; Nifty above 24,800; Bajaj Finserv gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 410.19 points to close at 81,596.63, while the NSE Nifty added 129.55 points to end at 24,813.45.

Can Sensex hit 1,00,000 in 12 months? Here's what Morgan Stanley saysThe bull case, where Sensex hits 1 lakh within the next 12 months, rests on more aggressive assumptions: oil prices persistently below $65/barrel, progress on farm reforms, GST rate cuts, and CAGR of 19% in corporate earnings. Relief from global trade tensions would further fuel this scenario.

Leela Hotels IPO details: Check price band, GMP, subscription and listing dateLeela Hotels IPO will open for bidding on May 26, 2025 and will close on May 28, 2025. Price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 413 and Rs 435 per share.

Gensol's books under review: NFRA launches preliminary probeIn April, Sebi took action against Gensol Engineering and its promoters brothers Anmol Jaggi and Puneet Jaggi. The market regulator barred the two from accessing the stock markets and called for a forensic audit into the affairs of the company.
Explained : Why Moody's thinks tariffs won't slow down India's economyThe credit ratings agency said India is in a better position than many other emerging markets to handle the tariff challenges.

Accenture promotions: 15,000 India staff finally get nod, says reportAccenture will offer 50,000 promotions globally. The global consulting and technology firm, which is headquartered in Dublin, had initially planned to roll out promotions in December 2024.

entertainment.headline: Dhanush is APJ Abdul Kalam in Om Raut-directed biopic, film launched at CannesActor Dhanush will play 'Missile Man of India' and former President of India, Dr APJ Abdul Kalam, in his biography, directed by Om Raut. The film was launched at the 78th Cannes Film Festival.
Salman Khan to return with Bigg Boss 19 in July: ReportSalman Khan-hosted 'Bigg Boss 19' is reportedly set to return in July. As per reports, the actor will shoot for the promo at the end of June.

Dhadkan and its silent misogyny: Why Anjali lived a flawed fairytale of endurance'Dhadkan' is often seen as a classic love triangle, but below the surface, it tells a troubling story of a woman forced to make a choice from options available to her by patriarchy. The film glorifies sacrifice and sends a dangerous message about what it means to be a 'good woman' in love.

Don't dub Kannada movies in Hindi: Sonu Nigam slams BJP leader over language rowPlayback singer Sonu Nigam sparked a debate on the use of local language in public sector jobs after an SBI manager refused to speak Kannada. The singer asked BJP leader Tejasvi Surya if the local language should be made mandatory for software professionals and American clients too.

Rana Naidu Season 2: Rana Daggubati's gritty actioner set for June releaseThe release date of Rana Daggubati and Venkatesh's 'Rana Naidu Season 2' has been announced. The makers shared the announcement with a fresh new promo on May 21.

Kapil Sharma's show's team mourns photographer Krishna Das's death: He was familyComedian Kiku Sharda and the team of Kapil Sharma's show expressed grief after the death of photographer Krishna Das. The team released an emotional statement. Dada, who was seen interacting with celebrities in The Kapil Sharma Show.

Zootopia 2 trailer: Nick and Judy reunite for a new case, Disney unveils fresh facesDisney has dropped the first 'Zootopia 2' trailer, reuniting the iconic duo with a fresh squad. Stealing the spotlight is Gary De'Snake, a hilarious new pit viper character.

Homebound team gets emotional as it receives 9-minute standing ovation at CannesNeeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' received a heartwarming 9-minute standing ovation at the Cannes Film Festival 2025, leaving the cast and crew emotional. The only Indian feature at Cannes this year, the film has been praised for its powerful storytelling and performances.

Actor Ravi Mohan's wife Aarti files petition seeking Rs 40 lakh monthly alimonyRavi Mohan's estranged wife, Aarti, has demanded a hefty alimony of Rs 40 lakh per month in their ongoing divorce case. The couple appeared before the Chennai Family Court, where both filed their respective petitions.

Mohanlal unveils Vrusshabha first look, back in warrior-king modeActor Mohanlal unveiled the first look of his upcoming magnum opus 'Vrusshabha' on his 65th birthday. The actor also shared a personal message for fans revealing the release date of the film.

Why there's no Hera Pheri without Paresh Rawal's Baburao Ganpatrao ApteParesh Rawal's portrayal of Baburao Ganpatrao Apte aka Babu Bhaiya in the 'Hera Pheri' franchise is considered one of his best performances. What makes it one of the most iconic cinematic portrayals in Hindi cinema? Why can nobody replace Rawal as Baburao? A glimpse at how the actor is an inevitable force of the 'Hera Pheri' franchise.

Maranamass director discusses crafting unconventional dark comedy with Basil JosephMalayalam director Sivaprasad made a striking commercial debut with 'Maranamass', a dark comedy thriller that brings a fresh and experimental flavour to the industry. In an interview with us, he talked about how the film blends humour with unconventional storytelling to offer a unique cinematic experience.

Campus Beats creator on K-dramas' popularity in India: We have nothing for youthCampus Beats, a dance-based fiction show created by Palki Malhotra, has resonated deeply with young Indian audiences by addressing their relatable experiences and emotions. The show's success highlights a gap in Indian youth content, especially when compared to the popularity of Korean dramas during the OTT boom.

Ex-Pentagon member Kino wants to collaborate with W.i.S.H. Girl band reactsSouth Korean artist Kino expressed his desire to collaborate with Indian girl band W.i.S.H, sparking excitement among the group. The band members feel thrilled that their music has reached South Korea and are eager for future global collaborations.

Pawan Kalyan gets objectionable item song lyrics changed in Hari Hara Veera MalluAhead of the release of 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1 – Sword vs Spirit', music director MM Keeravani revealed that Pawan Kalyan had the item song lyrics rewritten to avoid objectification.

Chris Brown granted bail in London assault case ahead of world tourChris Brown was granted bail by a London court after a serious assault charge. This development allows his world tour to proceed despite ongoing legal challenges.

Rahul Bhat on playing politician Sanjay Gandhi: Tried to get his aura rightRahul Bhat is gearing up to portray politician Sanjay Gandhi in Sudhir Mishra's 'Summer of 77', aiming to capture his unique aura. In an exclusive interview, he also opened up about the time when he met the politician as a child.

Thank you for not doing it: Shabana Azmi to Aparna Sen for turning down AnkurVeteran actors Shabana Azmi and Aparna Sen came together at the Habitat Film Festival to honour late filmmaker Shyam Benegal. The event also celebrated Shabana's remarkable 50-year journey in Indian cinema.

AR Rahman on long-standing collaboration with Mani Ratnam: He has seen my growthComposer AR Rahman, in an interview with India Today, opened up about his collaboration with director Mani Ratnam. He also shared that they have mutual respect for each other.

general news.headline: Terrorists trapped as gunfight breaks out with security forces in J&K's KishtwarAs per initial reports, security forces have successfully trapped 3-4 terrorists in the Singhpora area of Chatroo.

You're a disgrace: Trump goes off on reporter over Qatar plane questionTrump clashed with an NBC reporter over questions about a Qatari jet gifted to the US Air Force, accusing the network of diverting attention from violence against white farmers in South Africa.

Panic, cries as IndiGo flight hits turbulence, lands in Srinagar with broken noseAn IndiGo flight 6E2142 encountered severe hailstorm turbulence while approaching Srinagar, damaging the aircraft's nose cone while attempting to land. All passengers and crew members were evacuated safely upon landing.

Army chief puts Yunus on notice: What it means for a beleaguered BangladeshOn Wednesday, in a Durbar bringing together "all available officers in combat uniform" at Dhaka's Senaprangan, General Waker declared that the interim government will have to hold national elections by December this year.
Ivory saree and sindoor: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's regal Cannes comebackAishwarya Rai Bachchan returned to Cannes red carpet, clad in an elegant ivory saree by designer Manish Malhotra.

News Menu, May 22: PM in Bikaner airbase today, Waqf case continues in top courtIndia Today's Thursday news menu serves a fiery blend of bitter courtroom battles, Chhattisgarh's action-packed Naxal crackdown, Delhi's massive dust storm, IndiGo passengers' brush with danger, and more.

Trump takes credit for everything: Ex-aide on India-Pak ceasefire claimFormer US NSA John Bolton dismissed Trump's claim of mediating peace between India and Pakistan, saying he "takes credit for everything." He called it typical behaviour, adding it's "nothing against India, it's just Trump being Trump".

Nepali spy, sleeper cells: Pak ISI's big terror plot before Pahalgam attackDuring the arrest, investigators recovered classified documents and incriminating digital evidence from Nepali-origin ISI agent, Ansarul Mian Ansari. A forensic analysis confirmed these to be confidential military files.

Don't dub Kannada movies in Hindi: Sonu Nigam slams BJP leader over language rowPlayback singer Sonu Nigam fanned the debate on the use of local language in public sector jobs with a couple of tweets tagging BJP MP Tejasvi Surya. Nigam's comments come after a manager of a local SBI branch refused to speak Kannada and the BJP leader asked to make local language mandatory for banking sector.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Maoist Basavaraju killed: How 50-hour-long Op Kagar ended era of red terrorMaoist General Secretary Nambala Keshava Rao, aka Basavaraju, was killed in a 50-hour operation in Chhattisgarh's Abujhmad forests, dealing a major blow to the CPI (Maoist) leadership and network.

Hamas chief Mohammed Sinwar likely killed in Gaza airstrike, says NetanyahuIsraeli PM Netanyahu said Hamas leader Mohammed Sinwar was "probably" killed in Gaza. Despite allowing aid trucks in, supplies haven't reached civilians. Netanyahu pledged continued military operations for Gaza control.

Out or Not Out? Fans question controversial umpiring decision in MI's win over DCAbishek Porel's contentious stumping during Delhi Capitals' must-win match against Mumbai Indians at the Wankhede Stadium on Wednesday has sparked widespread debate, overshadowing what was otherwise a dominant 59-run win for the home side.

Power out, trees uprooted, banners toppled after massive storm hits DelhiSeveral parts of Delhi, Noida, Gurgaon, and Ghaziabad witnessed intense hailstorms and rain following the dust storm leading to widespread disruptions.

3,000 Agniveers braved Pak assault in Operation Sindoor, guarded key installationsFrom manning critical air defence systems to holding their ground across multiple installations, cities, and airbases despite repeated enemy assaults, the Agniveers' performance matched that of regular soldiers.

Don't have a plane to give you: South African President's witty jab at TrumpSouth African President Cyril Ramaphosa met Donald Trump at the White House. He joked about not having a plane to give, while Trump argued with a reporter and showed a video about white farmers, which Ramaphosa calmly responded to.

Who's the next BJP chief? Naddaji, Khargeji, Kya farak padta jiThe answer to the question — who's the next BJP chief — is a question — does it really matter? The party president's post in both the BJP and the Congress comes with great responsibilities, and little power. In the BJP, the party chief is in the driving seat of a Tesla Autopilot, steered remotely. But at least, its present and future are safe.

It was my decision to promote Gen Munir to Field Marshal: Shehbaz SharifShehbaz Sharif said it was his decision to promote Gen Asim Munir to Field Marshal for his role in the India conflict, stressing peace and outlining future dialogue priorities.

Operation Murshidabad exposes the masterminds of riots in BengalIn this episode of India First, watch India Today's special investigation Operation Murshidabad, which exposes how locals were involved in mobilising youth for the violence that took place in West Bengal's Murshidabad on April 11.

Watch: Nita Ambani's No. 6 celebration goes viral after MI reach IPL playoffsIPL 2025 MI vs DC: Following Mumbai Indians' commanding 59-run win over Delhi Capitals on Wednesday, owner Nita Ambani was seen holding up six fingers, telling the world that the five-time champions are coming for the big prize. MI became the fourth and final team to qualify for the playoffs.

Dhadkan and its silent misogyny: Why Anjali lived a flawed fairytale of endurance'Dhadkan' is often seen as a classic love triangle, but below the surface, it tells a troubling story of a woman forced to make a choice from options available to her by patriarchy. The film glorifies sacrifice and sends a dangerous message about what it means to be a 'good woman' in love.

At White House, Trump confronts South African President over white genocide claimsIn a tense White House meeting, President Trump confronted South African President Cyril Ramaphosa with graphic claims of violence against white farmers, including a video and news clippings.

Mahmoud Khalil denied chance to hold his newborn baby, family saysMahmoud Khalil, a detained Columbia graduate and Palestinian activist, was not allowed to hold his newborn son during a visit. ICE cited security concerns, forcing him to see his baby behind glass, sparking outrage from his wife and lawyers.

Short-range drones recovered along Pak border after ceasefire, probe on: SourcesThese drones resemble inexpensive, locally operable models, and intelligence teams plan to seek e-commerce data to trace their procurement.

sports.headline: IPL 2025: DC head coach rues missed yorkers, Axar Patel absence in MI lossHemang Badani lamented Delhi's failure to execute yorkers and the absence of Axar Patel after their 59-run loss to Mumbai Indians ended their IPL 2025 playoff hopes and exposed gaps in their bowling depth.

Tottenham Hotspurs captain Son Heung-min accepts legend tag after Europa winSon Heung-min finally called himself a Spurs legend after captaining Tottenham to their first European trophy — a historic Europa League win over Manchester United that ended a 17-year wait and booked a Champions League return.

How Pollard is turning Naman Dhir into Mumbai Indians' designated finisherIPL 2025, MI vs DC: Mumbai Indians batter Naman Dhir credited his rising success as a finisher to the consistent guidance of his side's batting coach Kieron Pollard alomg with his captain Hardik Pandya.

How Mumbai Indians can finish in top two after sealing their berth in playoffsHaving sealed their berth in the playoffs with a thumping win over Delhi Capitals (DC), Mumbai Indians (MI) can also finish in top two to have two chances to make it to the final.

Tottenham end 17-year wait with Europa League title win over Manchester UnitedBrennan Johnson's goal proved to be the difference as Tottenham Hotspur ended a 17-year trophy drought to beat Manchester United to win the Europa League.

Bangladesh slip to new low, lose T20I series to UAE for first timeBangladesh succumbed to a 2-1 series defeat against the United Arab Emirates, marking the first time the Tigers have lost a T20I series to the Associate nation. The UAE chased down a 163-run target with seven wickets in hand and five balls to spare to script a memorable win in the series decider.

Watch: Nita Ambani's No. 6 celebration goes viral after MI reach IPL playoffsIPL 2025 MI vs DC: Following Mumbai Indians' commanding 59-run win over Delhi Capitals on Wednesday, owner Nita Ambani was seen holding up six fingers, telling the world that the five-time champions are coming for the big prize. MI became the fourth and final team to qualify for the playoffs.

Suryakumar recalls wife's sweet story after ending wait for POTM awardIPL 2025, MI vs DC: Suryakumar Yadav dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife after his match-winning 73-run knock helped Mumbai Indians hammer Delhi Capitals by 59 runs to book a place in the playoffs.

Fans question controversial umpiring decision in MI's win over DCAbishek Porel's contentious stumping during Delhi Capitals' must-win match against Mumbai Indians at the Wankhede Stadium on Wednesday has sparked widespread debate, overshadowing what was otherwise a dominant 59-run win for the home side.

Clinical MI crush Delhi Capitals, reach playoffs after familiar resurgenceIPL 2025, MI vs DC: Suryakumar Yadav's well-paced 73 and a spin-bowling masterclass from Mitchell Santner helped Mumbai Indians hammer Delhi Capitals by 59 runs and qualify for the playoffs.

Suryakumar Yadav finds joy in long-awaited rescue act, smashes 43-ball 73IPL 2025, MI vs DC: Suryakumar Yadav played an uncharacteristic knock, waiting for his moment before going big. The experienced batter hit 73 off 43 balls to help Mumbai post 180 in a crunch game on Wednesday, May 21.

MI became the fourth and final team to qualify for the playoffs.

Fans question controversial umpiring decision in MI's win over DCAbishek Porel's contentious stumping during Delhi Capitals' must-win match against Mumbai Indians at the Wankhede Stadium on Wednesday has sparked widespread debate, overshadowing what was otherwise a dominant 59-run win for the home side.

Suryakumar Yadav finds joy in long-awaited rescue act, smashes 43-ball 73IPL 2025, MI vs DC: Suryakumar Yadav played an uncharacteristic knock, waiting for his moment before going big. The experienced batter hit 73 off 43 balls to help Mumbai post 180 in a crunch game on Wednesday, May 21.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
